title: 2 Richfield Students, Mother ID'd as Minneapolis Shooting Victims
content:
Luis, left, and Nahily Ronquillo
The Richfield School District has identified three victims in a domestic shooting Friday in Minneapolis.
According to a statement issued by Superintendent Steven Unowsky and school board chairman Peter Toensing, fifth-grader Nahily Ronquillo and her brother, eighth-grader Luis Ronquillo, were killed in the shooting on the 5400 block of 34th Avenue South.
The school district also identified a third victim, the children’s mother, Maria Romero. The statement said Romero was hospitalized.
The statement said that Romero was a former school district employee.
Officers say they arrived at the scene and found three people dead in an apartment: a boy and girl in their early teens and a man. Officers also found a woman who was alive but critically hurt.
